thread.title: Patriots re-sign Rob Gronkowski's younger brother yet again
thread.title_full: Patriots re-sign Rob Gronkowski's younger brother yet again

title: Patriots re-sign Rob Gronkowski's younger brother yet again
text:
More Patriots re-sign Rob Gronkowski’s younger brother yet again INDIANAPOLIS, IN - FEBRUARY 25: Fullback Glenn Gronkowski #11 of Kansas State speaks to the media during the 2016 NFL Scouting Combine at Lucas Oil Stadium on February 25, 2016 in Indianapolis, Indiana. (Photo by Jotêcu±î^hZÎ¨§Vµ5!Ke)¤îiÛ Feb 14, 2017 at 5:34p ET 0Shares 
The New England Patriots just can’t enough of Rob Gronkowski’s younger brother. The defending champs re-signed fullback Glenn Gronkowski, who had four different stints with the team in 2016, to a futures contract Tuesday. 
The 22-year-old, who went undrafted last year, made the Bills’ 53-man roster but was released by Buffalo in September. Gronkowski initially joined the Patriots’ practice squad in October. 
Rob Gronkowski was limited to eight games last season and had back surgery, forcing the Pro Bowl tight end to sit out the Patriots’ run to their fifth Super Bowl title. 0
